options.text: The majority of patients with this presentation are found to have pneumonia or multiple septic emboli on a chest radiograph

questions.correct_answer: B. Gram-negative bacilli are a prominent cause of such lesions

questions.text: A 54-year-old man with a history of hypertension and previously unknown and untreated human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) infection presents with worsening shortness of breath. The chest radiograph shows diffuse bilateral infiltrates that is found to represent Pneumocystis jiroveci pneumonia. An echocardiogram is performed to assess left ventricular function, and the study is notable for a small posterior pericardial effusion without cardiac chamber compression. Which one of the following statements regarding pericardial effusion in patients with HIV infection is TRUE?

options.label: A
options.text: Progression to cardiac tamponade is likely

options.label: B
options.text: Direct HIV infection of the pericardium is almost exclusively the cause of such effusions

options.label: C
options.text: Pericardial effusion has become an extremely rare cardiac manifestation of HIV infection in patients treated with highly active antiretroviral therapy

options.label: D
options.text: Most effusions of this type require glucocorticoid therapy for resolution

questions.correct_answer: C. Pericardial effusion has become an extremely rare cardiac manifestation of HIV infection in patients treated with highly active antiretroviral therapy

questions.text: A 36-year-old man presents to the emergency department with shortness of breath. A grade III/VI systolic murmur is auscultated at the apex. Pulse is 110/min,BP-130/70 mmHg with LV S3 present. The chest radiograph demonstrates pulmonary vascular congestion. Echocardiography in the emergency department confirms the presence of mitral regurgitation and vigorous left ventricular contractile function. Which of the following findings would suggest the acute onset of mitral regurgitation?

options.label: A
options.text: Presence of cardiomegaly on the chest radiograph

options.label: B
options.text: Left atrial and ventricular hypertrophy on the ECG

options.label: C
options.text: The systolic murmur is short and ends in mid systole

questions.correct_answer: C. The systolic murmur is short and ends in mid systole

questions.text: A 45-year-old woman is evaluated by her physician because of the new onset of pleuritic, positional left anterior chest pain that radiates to the left trapezius ridge. Pain increases on supine and decreases on leaning forward position. Three weeks earlier she had been evaluated for a viral respiratory tract infection. Cardiac auscultation reveals evanescent coarse scratching sounds at the lower left sternal border with components in both systole and diastole. There is no cardiac murmur. Which of the following statements about expected findings on this patient’s electrocardiogram is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: ST-segment elevations with a convex upward configuration are likely

options.label: B
options.text: PR-segment depressions may be the only electrocardiographic manifestation

options.label: C
options.text: Reciprocal ST-segment depressions are typically present

options.label: D
options.text: T-wave inversions develop concurrently with ST-segment elevations

questions.correct_answer: B. PR-segment depressions may be the only electrocardiographic manifestation

questions.text: A 75-year-old woman with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease and chronic renal insufficiency presents with fever, rigors, productive cough, and worsening shortness of breath. On physical examination she is overtly dyspneic, the temperature is 38.9°C (102.1°F), heart rate 120 beats/min, and blood pressure 82/50 mm Hg. The chest radiograph shows a dense left lower lobe infiltrate and symmetric enlargement of the cardiac silhouette. Echocardiography demonstrates a large circumferential pericardial effusion. She is admitted to the intensive care unit for suspected bacterial pericarditis. Which of the following statements is true?

options.label: A
options.text: Uremic pericarditis with a preexisting pericardial effusion predisposes to bacterial pericarditis

options.label: B
options.text: Direct extension into the pericardium of bacterial pneumonia accounts for only a minority of cases of purulent pericarditis

options.label: C
options.text: Bacterial pericarditis is most often a subacute illness

options.label: D
options.text: The modern survival rate of this condition is excellent

questions.correct_answer: A. Uremic pericarditis with a preexisting pericardial effusion predisposes to bacterial pericarditis

questions.text: A 16-year-old asymptomatic teenager undergoes physical examination before competing in high school athletics. His mother states that a first cousin died suddenly while playing basketball and she recalls that there was something wrong with his heart. His vital signs are heart rate 64 beats/min, respirations 12 breaths/min, and blood pressure 120/75 mm Hg. His cardiac examination is remarkable for a grade 2/6 systolic ejection murmur along the left sternal border, which decreases with squatting and increases with sudden standing. The ECG shows left ventricular hypertrophy (LVH) with prominent septal forces and echocardiography confirms marked LVH. Your recommendations regarding participation in athletics are:

options.label: C
options.text: Competitive sports with beta blocker therapy are acceptable

options.label: D
options.text: High-intensity competitive sports are acceptable with beta blocker therapy

questions.correct_answer: A. No competitive sports

questions.text: A 76-year-old man presents to the emergency department with aphasia and dense right hemiplegia. His wife reports that he had experienced intermittent fevers and chills over the previous 2 weeks. Cardiac examination is notable for a grade 2/6 systolic ejection murmur at the upper right sternal border and grade 1/4 early diastolic murmur at the upper left sternal border. Four sets of blood cultures grow Staphylococcus aureus. A transthoracic echocardiogram demonstrates normal left ventricular contractile function and mild aortic stenosis. No vegetations are seen. Computed tomography of the head shows an acute non hemorrhagic stroke in the territory of the left middle cerebral artery. Which of the following statements is TRUE?

options.label: A
options.text: The presenting stroke is an indication for urgent valve replacement

options.label: B
options.text: Endocarditis caused by S. aureus is an absolute indication for surgery

options.label: C
options.text: Despite the aggressiveness of S. aureus native valve endocarditis, antibiotic therapy alone without surgical intervention is often curative

options.label: D
options.text: Even if intractable heart failure develops, corrective valve surgery should be postponed until after blood cultures have become sterile

questions.correct_answer: C. Despite the aggressiveness of S. aureus native valve endocarditis, antibiotic therapy alone without surgical intervention is often curative

questions.text: A 42-year-old previously healthy salesman presents to his physician with a complaint of lower extremity edema. On further questioning, he says he has also experienced “flushing” episodes over the past several months, intermittent wheezing, and episodic diarrhea. On physical examination, there is jugular venous distention, a prominent holosystolic murmur at the lower left sternal border, a pulsatile liver, and peripheral edema. The urinary 5-hydroxyindoleacetic acid level is markedly elevated. Which of the following statements is TRUE?

options.label: A
options.text: The underlying disorder involves gastrointestinal tract

options.label: B
options.text: Echocardiography typically demonstrates thickened mitral and/or aortic valve leaflets with left ventricular dilatation

options.label: C
options.text: The symptoms are associated with low levels of circulating serotonin

options.label: D
options.text: The primary disease usually invades the myocardium

questions.correct_answer: A. The underlying disorder involves gastrointestinal tract

questions.text: A 65-year-old woman presents for evaluation of known mitral stenosis. Over the past few months she has developed worsening exertional dyspnea. Pulse is irregularly irregular with pulse deficit of 15/min. a waves are not seen in JVP. Opening snap is present. ECG shows atrial fibrillation.ECHO reveals severe MS without significant calcification. Which of the following statements regarding percutaneous balloon mitral valvotomy for this condition is TRUE? A. Balloon valvotomy is not indicated B. Transthoracic echocardiography is the appropriate imaging study before the procedure to exclude the presence of left atrial thrombus C. Balloon mitral valvuloplasty is the treatment of choice in this patient D. All

options.label: B
options.text: Transthoracic echocardiography is the appropriate imaging study before the procedure to exclude the presence of left atrial thrombus

options.label: C
options.text: Balloon mitral valvuloplasty is the treatment of choice in this patient

questions.correct_answer: C. Balloon mitral valvuloplasty is the treatment of choice in this patient

questions.text: A 54-year-old man with a bicuspid aortic valve presents with a 1-week history of fevers and chills. Initial blood cultures are negative, but echocardiography reveals a large vegetation on the aortic valve. On the fifth hospital day, blood cultures become positive for gram-negative bacteria. Which of the following is NOT a member of the fastidious, slow-growing group of HACEK organisms that may be the cause of this patient’s endocarditis?
questions.correct_answer: D. Escherichia coli

questions.text: A 27-year-old woman presents with 2 days of shortness of breath. The plasma D-dimer level is elevated. A high-resolution chest computed tomographic scan reveals a segmental pulmonary embolism, and deep vein thrombosis is found in the right femoral vein. She denies any recent travel, immobility, or surgery. Which of the following primary hypercoagulable states is most frequent among patients who present with deep vein thrombosis?
questions.correct_answer: B. Activated protein C resistance

questions.text: A 48-year-old man comes to the office because of episodic palpitations. His other symptoms include paroxysmal nocturnal dyspnea, nocturnal enuresis, and mild angina. His wife adds that he snores loudly. He has a history of several recent automobile accidents. On examination, his blood pressure is elevated at 190/100 mm Hg and he is moderately overweight. Laboratory evaluation reveals a hematocrit of 58%. ECHO is done. What will be likely finding
questions.correct_answer: C. Right ventricular hypertrophy

questions.text: A 78-year-old man describes exertional dyspnea 3 days after a 12-hour intercontinental flight. His blood pressure is 128/76 mm Hg, heart rate 92 beats/min and regular. His oxygen saturation is 96%. He weighs 78 kg. There is no jugular venous distension, the chest is clear to auscultation, and there is no peripheral edema or calf tenderness. The serum D-dimer is elevated and subsequent imaging demonstrates a segmental pulmonary embolism and thrombus within the left femoral vein. There are no echocardiographic signs of right ventricular strain. Serum electrolyte measurements are normal, the serum creatinine is 1.0 mg/dL, and the estimated creatinine clearance is 62 mL/min. His current medications are atorvastatin 20 mg daily and lisinopril 10 mg daily. Of the following choices, which would be the best initial anticoagulation strategy?

options.label: A
options.text: Enoxaparin 1 mg/kg subcutaneous injection once, followed by oral warfarin daily to achieve an INR of 2.0-3.0

options.label: C
options.text: Rivaroxaban 20 mg orally once daily, with the evening meal

options.label: D
options.text: Apixaban 10 mg orally twice daily for 7 days, then 5 mg twice daily

questions.correct_answer: D. Apixaban 10 mg orally twice daily for 7 days, then 5 mg twice daily

questions.text: A 20-year-old previously healthy woman is brought to the hospital because of fatigue and exertional dyspnea over the past month. Past medical history is unremarkable except for an upper respiratory tract infection 4 weeks earlier. She is not pregnant. There is no family history of cardiac illness. She does not consume alcoholic beverages or use illicit drugs. On examination in the emergency department, the patient’s blood pressure is 90/60 mm Hg and the heart rate is 110 beats/min. The jugular veins are distended to 10 cm H2O, the chest examination reveals bilateral rales, and on cardiac examination there is a prominent apical S3 gallop. An echocardiogram demonstrates dilatation of both ventricles with diffuse hypokinesia; the left ventricular ejection fraction is 15%. Which one of the following statements regarding this patient’s disorder is NOT correct?

options.label: A
options.text: The most likely etiology of this patient’s disorder is viral

options.label: B
options.text: Myocardial biopsy would not likely reveal a specific etiology

options.label: C
options.text: Corticosteroids will likely slow progression of the illness

options.label: D
options.text: Serum cardiac troponin elevation may occur in the absence of coronary artery disease

questions.correct_answer: C. Corticosteroids will likely slow progression of the illness

questions.text: Which of the following is not true about the condition described in the question?

options.label: A
options.text: In industrialized nations, the incidence of this disorder has decreased markedly in recent decades

options.label: B
options.text: This condition is the most common cause of pericardial disease in African HIV-infected patients

options.label: C
options.text: Clinical detection of this disorder usually occurs either in the effusive stage or after the development of constrictive pericarditis

options.label: D
options.text: The acute onset of characteristic severe pericardial pain is common

questions.correct_answer: D. The acute onset of characteristic severe pericardial pain is common

questions.text: A 54-year-old man presented with increasing dyspnea on exertion. He was initially treated for an upper respiratory tract infection; however, his symptoms persisted. A subsequent echocardiogram revealed an intracardiac mass suggestive of a malignant tumor. Regarding primary malignancies of the heart, which of the following statements is TRUE?

options.label: A
options.text: The right atrium is the most common site of involvement

options.label: B
options.text: The vast majority of patients already have metastases at the time of diagnosis

options.label: C
options.text: Malignant tumors account for half of primary cardiac tumors

options.label: D
options.text: Lymphomas are the most common primary malignancies of the heart

questions.correct_answer: A. The right atrium is the most common site of involvement

questions.text: A 63-year-old man without known cardiac history presented with a 4-month history of dyspnea on exertion and lower extremity edema. Echocardiography revealed a normal LV ejection fraction with no significant valvular disease. A chest computed tomographic scan showed a dense rim of calcium around the heart. Coronary angiography showed no significant coronary disease. Hemodynamic evaluation demonstrated elevation and equalization of right and left ventricular diastolic pressures with a “dip and plateau” configuration. Which of the following statements about this condition is correct?

options.label: B
options.text: The mortality rate associated with pericardiectomy <0.1%

options.label: C
options.text: Nearly all patients develop a high-output syndrome immediately after pericardiectomy due to rapid expansion of the heart

options.label: D
options.text: Pericardiectomy should be reserved only for patients with New York Heart Association functional class III or IV symptoms

questions.correct_answer: A. Evaluation for tuberculosis is appropriate

questions.text: A 25-year-old woman presents to her primary care doctor with fatigue and a rash. She recently returned from a vacation during which she hiked at least 6 km daily. On physical examination she has a well-demarcated erythematous rash with central clearing on her chest. Lyme disease is suspected. Which of the following statements regarding cardiac involvement in Lyme disease is TRUE?

options.label: A
options.text: Cardiac manifestations of Lyme disease typically occur within days of the development of erythema chronicum migrans

options.label: B
options.text: Lyme disease patients develop cardiac manifestations rarely nowadays

options.label: C
options.text: Supraventricular and ventricular tachyarrhythmias are the most common cardiac manifestations of Lyme disease

options.label: D
options.text: Cardiomegaly and congestive heart failure are common among patients who develop Lyme carditis

questions.correct_answer: B. Lyme disease patients develop cardiac manifestations rarely nowadays

questions.text: A 54-year-old man presents to his physician with a 1-week history of dyspnea on exertion, cough, and pleuritic chest pain. His examination is notable for an elevated jugular venous pressure, distant heart sounds, and mild bilateral lower extremity edema. The chest radiograph reveals an enlarged cardiac silhouette. Echocardiography demonstrates a large circumferential pericardial effusion. An echocardiographicguided pericardiocentesis is performed, removing most of the fluid; cytologic evaluation reveals adenocarcinoma. Which one of the following statements is NOT correct?

options.label: A
options.text: The most likely primary malignancy in this patient is in the lung

options.label: B
options.text: The prognosis is poor despite aggressive surgery or chemotherapy

options.label: C
options.text: Pericardial sclerotherapy would not significantly improve the long-term prognosis

options.label: D
options.text: Total surgical pericardiectomy should be performed urgently

questions.correct_answer: D. Total surgical pericardiectomy should be performed urgently

questions.text: A 34-year-old man presents to the emergency department with pleuritic chest pain after a recent upper respiratory tract infection. The pain is positional, relieved by sitting up. Cardiac examination is notable for a three-component friction rub. The ECG demonstrates diffuse ST-segment elevation with PR-segment depression in several leads. Which of the following statements about the evolution of the ECG in this condition is correct?

options.label: B
options.text: Initial ST-segment elevation is usually most prominent in lead aVR

options.label: C
options.text: The ratio of the height of ST-segment elevation to the height of the T wave in this condition is typically >0.25

options.label: D
options.text: Reciprocal ST depression changes are seen

questions.correct_answer: C. The ratio of the height of ST-segment elevation to the height of the T wave in this condition is typically >0.25

questions.text: A 78 year old male presented to OPD with complaints of chest pain which is retrosternal is location and increases on physical activity and decreased by rest. He has episodes of dizziness more during walking. On examination pulse shows a delayed peak in systole,BP-120/70 mmHg, heart sound S4 is present at apex. There is ejection systolic murmur best heard at right second intercostal space radiating to neck. A clinical diagnosis of aortic stenosis is made. Which of the following statements regarding the natural history of untreated aortic stenosis in patient is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: Average survival from the onset of syncopal symptoms is approximately 6 months

options.label: B
options.text: Average survival from the onset of congestive heart failure is approximately 2 years

options.label: C
options.text: Syncope due to AS usually occurs at rest

options.label: D
options.text: Sudden death in patients with AS usually occurs in previously asymptomatic individuals

questions.correct_answer: B. Average survival from the onset of congestive heart failure is approximately 2 years

questions.text: A 46-year-old postmenopausal woman with a history of systemic sclerosis is admitted to the coronary care unit because of progressive dyspnea and chest pain. Initial data include blood pressure 88/56 mm Hg, heart rate 104 /min, and oxygen saturation 95%. General examination is notable for cool extremities and symmetric edema of the lower extremities. The electrocardiogram demonstrates right ventricular hypertrophy. Contrast enhanced thoracic computed tomography demonstrates RV cavitary enlargement without pulmonary embolism. Coronary arteriography shows minimal coronary artery disease without coronary vasospasm. Right heart catheterization reveals the following: mean pulmonary artery pressure 61 mm Hg; mean pulmonary capillary wedge pressure 10 mm Hg; pulmonary vascular resistance 16.2 Wood units (1296 dyn•sec•cm?5 ).Cardiac output is low with cardiac Index of 2.0 L/min/m2. Which of the following is the most appropriate initial treatment for this patient?

options.label: C
options.text: Tissue plasminogen activator 100 mg, administered as a continuous IV infusion over 2 hours

questions.correct_answer: B. Intravenous epoprostenol initiated at 2 ng/kg/min

questions.text: A 46-year-old man is admitted to the hospital because of worsening shortness of breath. His history is notable for hypertension, treated with an angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitor. Social history reveals that he has consumed 360 ml of liquor daily for the past 10 years. Physical examination shows an elevated jugular venous pressure (14 cm), bibasilar rales on pulmonary examination, a laterally displaced cardiac apical impulse, a grade II/VI holosystolic murmur, an S3 gallop at the apex, and pitting edema of both lower extremities. Echocardiography demonstrates a dilated left ventricle with an ejection fraction of 25% and moderate mitral regurgitation. Which of the following statements regarding the cardiac effects of alcohol is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: Dilated cardiomyopathy due to alcohol consumption is irreversible

options.label: B
options.text: The likelihood of developing dilated cardiomyopathy correlates with the amount of alcohol consumed

options.label: C
options.text: Women are less susceptible than men to alcohol-associated cardiomyopathy

questions.correct_answer: B. The likelihood of developing dilated cardiomyopathy correlates with the amount of alcohol consumed

questions.text: A 55-year-old woman seeks medical attention because of progressive exertional dyspnea and rapid heart action. At age 12 she suffered from rheumatic fever, and a heart murmur has been subsequently noted. She has had intermittent episodes of atrial fibrillation over the past 2 years with good rate control on metoprolol succinate. Her vital signs include a heart rate of 80 beats/min, blood pressure 130/80 mm Hg, and respirations 16 breaths/min. She has inspiratory rales at the lung bases. Her cardiac impulse is displaced laterally. There is a loud S1, a single S2, an apical opening snap, a mid diastolic rumbling murmur at the apex, and early diastolic blowing murmur along the third left sternal border. Isometric handgrip augments the diastolic murmurs. She has mild peripheral edema. Her ECG is shown in Figure.
questions.correct_answer: C. Mitral stenosis and aortic regurgitation

questions.text: A 17-year-old boy has a syncopal event while playing soccer.He has history of young sudden cardiac death in paternal cousin brother.Pulse is Bisferiens and double cardiac apex is noted.On auscultation LV S4 and ejection systolic ejection murmur at erb’s area is present.ECG shows signs of LVH. An echocardiogram is obtained. Which of the following statements about hemodynamic findings on ECHO in patients with this condition is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: Diastolic function is usually impaired to a greater extent than systolic function

options.label: B
options.text: The majority of ventricular emptying is less rapid than usual

options.label: C
options.text: Left ventricular end-systolic volume is usually increased

options.label: D
options.text: Left ventricular ejection fraction is typically reduced

questions.correct_answer: A. Diastolic function is usually impaired to a greater extent than systolic function

questions.text: A 36-year-old woman with tetralogy of Fallot presents for routine outpatient evaluation. She had undergone surgical heart repair at age 5 months, including ventricular septal defect closure with a Dacron patch and relief of right ventricular outflow tract obstruction with a transannular patch. She denies shortness of breath or presyncope. Her electrocardiogram demonstrates normal sinus rhythm with intraventricular conducton delay (QRS duration = 190 msec). Cardiac magnetic resonance imaging reveals a low-normal left ventricular ejection fraction, severe pulmonary regurgitation, right ventricular dilatation with moderate right ventricular systolic dysfunction, and moderate tricuspid regurgitation. Cardiopulmonary exercise testing shows that her maximal oxygen consumption is 56% of the predicted value for her age and body surface area. Which of the following statements is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: She should be referred for pulmonary valve replacement

options.label: B
options.text: Her risk of sudden cardiac death is low

options.label: C
options.text: The presence of tricuspid regurgitation in this case does not influence the risk of developing atrial arrhythmias

options.label: D
options.text: She does not require antibiotic prophylaxis prior to dental procedures

questions.correct_answer: A. She should be referred for pulmonary valve replacement

questions.text: A 68-year-old man presents for evaluation of progressive dyspnea. He has an extensive smoking history. Pulmonary function testing is consistent with severe airway obstruction. An echocardiogram shows normal left ventricular systolic function, right ventricular hypertrophy and dilation, and an elevated calculated pulmonary artery systolic pressure. Which of the following therapies improves survival in patients with chronic obstructive lung disease with pulmonary hypertension?
questions.correct_answer: B. Oxygen

questions.text: A 54-year-old woman with chronic kidney disease presents to the emergency department because of sudden shortness of breath and right-sided pleuritic chest pain. She recently returned from vacation on a 12-hour flight. Physical examination demonstrates a tachypneic, normotensive, and tachycardic woman. The serum creatinine is chronically elevated, and precludes performing a chest computed tomographic angiogram. Which of the following results would be most useful in EXCLUDING the diagnosis of pulmonary embolism?

options.label: A
options.text: Normal PaO2 by arterial blood gas determination

options.label: C
options.text: Absence of right-sided heart strain or S1Q3T3 pattern on ECG

questions.correct_answer: D. Normal plasma level of D-dimer

questions.text: A 67-year-old man with adenocarcinoma of the lung presents with dyspnea and weakness. Physical examination is notable for hypotension with pulsus paradoxus and jugular venous distention with absence of y descent. BP is 80/60 mmHg.Heart sounds are soft,no murmur appreciated. An echocardiogram is ordered. Which of the following statements regarding echocardiography in this condition is TRUE?

options.label: A
options.text: A small-volume pericardial effusion observed on echocardiography excludes the presence of tamponade

options.label: B
options.text: The absence of right ventricular diastolic collapse ensures that the pericardial pressure is not elevated

options.label: C
options.text: Right ventricular diastolic collapse is more specific than right atrial collapse in the diagnosis of tamponade

questions.correct_answer: C. Right ventricular diastolic collapse is more specific than right atrial collapse in the diagnosis of tamponade

questions.text: A 64-year-old woman with a remote history of chest irradiation presents with gradually progressive symptoms of fatigue, abdominal bloating, and lower extremity edema over the past 4 months.Pulse is 100/min and BP-110/80 mmHg,neck veins are prominent. Her lateral chest radiograph is shown in Figure.

options.label: D
options.text: Right and left ventricular systolic pressure concordance during inspiration

questions.correct_answer: D. Right and left ventricular systolic pressure concordance during inspiration

questions.text: A 68-year-old man with chronic aortic regurgitation presents for office evaluation. He describes reduced stamina, progressive symptoms of exertional dyspnea, and occasional orthopnea. His echocardiogram shows severe aortic regurgitation, a left ventricular (LV) end-systolic diameter of 48 mm, and an LV ejection fraction of 45%. Which of the following statements regarding valve replacement for chronic aortic regurgitation (AR) is NOT correct?

options.label: A
options.text: Asymptomatic patients with advanced AR who have normal LV function and end-systolic diameter 55 mm before surgical intervention portends a worse postoperative prognosis than does a smaller ventricular diameter

options.label: B
options.text: Angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitors delay the need for aortic valve replacement in chronic AR

options.label: C
options.text: Patients with chronic AR who have symptoms of congestive heart failure accompanied by reduced LV ejection fraction should be referred for aortic valve replacement

questions.correct_answer: B. Angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitors delay the need for aortic valve replacement in chronic AR

questions.text: A 44-year-old man with human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) infection and a history of non-adherence to prescribed antiretroviral therapy presents to your office for evaluation of shortness of breath. He reports 2 months of progressive fatigue and dyspnea on exertion. His CD4 count is 15 cells/mm3 (normal = 500 to 1500 cells/mm3 ). Transthoracic echocardiography reveals a dilated heart with a left ventricular (LV) ejection fraction of 15% and a small pericardial effusion. Which of the following statements is TRUE?

options.label: A
options.text: Fifty percent of HIV-infected individuals will ultimately develop symptomatic LV dysfunction

options.label: B
options.text: Large asymptomatic pericardial effusions are the most common cardiac manifestation of HIV infection, but the presence of effusion is not associated with increased mortality

options.label: C
options.text: In HIV-infected individuals, LV dysfunction has little bearing on 1-year mortality rates

options.label: D
options.text: Protease inhibitor therapy is associated with an increased risk of myocardial infarction

questions.correct_answer: D. Protease inhibitor therapy is associated with an increased risk of myocardial infarction

questions.text: A 65-year-old man with a history of chest radiation therapy for lymphoma presents with worsening exertional dyspnea. On physical examination the heart rate is 120 beats/min, blood pressure 90/55 mm Hg, with pulsus paradoxus of 15 mm Hg. The jugular venous pressure is 10 cm H2O with a prominent x descent. He is found by echocardiography to have a large pericardial effusion, which is drained by pericardiocentesis in the cardiac catheterization laboratory. After the procedure, the intrapericardial pressure normalizes but the initially elevated right atrial pressure fails to decline and displays a prominent y descent. This scenario is most consistent with
questions.correct_answer: C. Effusive-constrictive pericarditis

questions.text: A 24-year-old man who is training for a merathon experiences a presyncopal event and is referred for evaluation. He has been training aggressively for the past 2 years and, aside from occasional single palpitations, has not noticed any prior lightheadedness, other cardiac symptoms, or physical limitations. He has no history of hypertension and his family history is free of premature coronary disease or sudden cardiac death (SCD). On physical examination his blood pressure and heart rate are normal. A grade II/VI rough crescendo-decrescendo systolic murmur is auscultated along the left sternal border, which becomes louder when the patient stands. The patient is anxious to return to his training regimen. Which of the following statements is TRUE?

options.label: A
options.text: Diffuse hypertrophy of LV seen in HCM

options.label: B
options.text: An echocardiographic end-diastolic septal wall thickness of 14 mm would be diagnostic of HCM

options.label: C
options.text: Persistent left ventricular hypertrophy by echocardiography 6 months after cessation of exercise is consistent with genetic HCM

questions.correct_answer: C. Persistent left ventricular hypertrophy by echocardiography 6 months after cessation of exercise is consistent with genetic HCM
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • B. An echocardiographic end-diastolic septal wall thickness of 14 mm would be diagnostic of HCM This statement is incorrect because an end-diastolic septal wall thickness of ≥15 mm is considered diagnostic for HCM in non-athletes. For athletes, who may have physiologic LVH as part of the adaptive remodeling process, wall thickness in the range of 12–16 mm may still be physiologic and not diagnostic of HCM. Clinical context, family history, and cessation of exercise for reevaluation are crucial in such cases.
  • • D. All This option is incorrect as A and B are inaccurate. Therefore, not all statements are true.

questions.text: A 20-year-old female student presents to the emergency department with recent malaise, myalgias, fevers, sweats, and claudication of the right lower extremity and left arm. On physical examination the blood pressure is 160/90 mm Hg in the right arm and 120/85 mm Hg in the left arm. The left radial and right femoral pulses are diminished and a left-sided subclavian bruit is auscultated. The erythrocyte sedimentation rate is markedly elevated. Which of the following statements about this condition is TRUE?

options.label: A
options.text: Arterial biopsy would reveal a polymorphonuclear infiltrate

options.label: B
options.text: Coronary vasculitis is not typical in this syndrome

options.label: C
options.text: This condition is more common in women than men

options.label: D
options.text: Claudication occurs more commonly in the lower extremities than the upper extremities

questions.correct_answer: C. This condition is more common in women than men

questions.text: A 58-year-old woman complains of a new-onset severe headache, jaw pain with chewing, and temporal artery tenderness. Laboratory examination shows an erythrocyte sedimentation rate (ESR) of 80 mm/h. Which of the following is TRUE regarding treatment of this condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Corticosteroids should not be administered until biopsy evidence confirms the diagnosis

options.label: B
options.text: Normalization of the ESR is a reliable indicator of treatment response

options.label: C
options.text: Anti-tumor necrosis factor (TNF) therapies have been shown to be beneficial in this condition

options.label: D
options.text: In the absence of contraindications, low-dose aspirin should be prescribed

questions.correct_answer: D. In the absence of contraindications, low-dose aspirin should be prescribed

questions.text: A 58-year-old woman in good health presents for evaluation. She is concerned about cardiovascular risk because her father sustained a myocardial infarction at age 70.On examination pulse is 80/minute,BP-130/80 mmHg.Chest is clear.CVS-normal heart sounds, no gallop noted. Which of the following statements about heart disease in women is NOT correct?

options.label: A
options.text: Cardiovascular disease is the leading cause of death in women

options.label: B
options.text: Hormone replacement therapy with estrogen reduce the risk of cardiac events in postmenopausal women

options.label: C
options.text: Coronary heart disease presents approximately 10 years later in women than in men

options.label: D
options.text: Cardiovascular disease is more common in women with diabetes compared with nondiabetics

questions.correct_answer: B. Hormone replacement therapy with estrogen reduce the risk of cardiac events in postmenopausal women

questions.text: A 36-year-old woman with no prior history of cardiac disease develops exertional dyspnea and orthopnea 1 month after delivering a healthy full-term infant. Echocardiography demonstrates a dilated left ventricle with globally reduced contractile function. Which of the following statements regarding peripartum cardiomyopathy (PPCM) is TRUE?

options.label: A
options.text: Symptoms of PPCM always arise during the last month of pregnancy or within 1 week after delivery

options.label: B
options.text: Clinical and hemodynamic findings in PPCM are indistinguishable from those of other forms of dilated cardiomyopathy

options.label: C
options.text: The incidence of PPCM is greatest in first pregnancies

options.label: D
options.text: Younger maternal age is a risk factor for PPCM

questions.correct_answer: B. Clinical and hemodynamic findings in PPCM are indistinguishable from those of other forms of dilated cardiomyopathy

questions.text: A previously healthy 17-year-old high school athlete collapses during a basketball game. He is noted to have brief seizure-like activity and has no initial pulse but is immediately resuscitated by a brisk precordial thump. Assuming that this event represents sudden cardiac death (SCD), which of the following statements is NOT correct?

options.label: A
options.text: Arrhythmogenic right ventricular cardiomyopathy is most common cause of SCD in young athletes

options.label: B
options.text: Anomalous origin of the left main coronary artery from the right coronary cusp is the most common of the congenital coronary abnormalities that result in SCD in young athletes

options.label: C
options.text: Congenital aortic stenosis is a cause of SCD in young athletes

options.label: D
options.text: Patients who experience SCD due to HCM often have no history of prior cardiac symptoms

questions.correct_answer: A. Arrhythmogenic right ventricular cardiomyopathy is most common cause of SCD in young athletes

questions.text: A 68-year-old woman with a history of hypertension presents to the emergency department with the new onset of dyspnea and nausea. The electrocardiogram shows anterolateral ST-segment depressions, and the initial serum measurement of cardiac troponin T is elevated. Which of the following statements is TRUE regarding women who present with acute coronary syndromes (ACS)?

options.label: A
options.text: Most women presenting with an acute myocardial infarction do not describe chest pain

options.label: B
options.text: Women presenting with myocardial infarction are less likely than men to have accompanying cardiovascular comorbidities

options.label: C
options.text: Women with ACS are more likely to present earlier in the course of symptoms than men

options.label: D
options.text: Women who present with chest discomfort are more likely than men to have nonatherosclerotic causes of ischemia, such as coronary vasospasm

questions.correct_answer: D. Women who present with chest discomfort are more likely than men to have nonatherosclerotic causes of ischemia, such as coronary vasospasm

questions.text: A 66-year-old man with end-stage renal disease and hypertension on hemodialysis presented with palpitations. On examination- Pulse is irregular with pulse deficit present. JVP has absent a waves. ECG showed atrial fibrillation. His CHA2DS2-VAS score is 2. It is determined that he needs anticoagulation for stroke prevention. Which of the following agents is safe for use in patients on hemodialysis?
questions.correct_answer: D. Warfarin

questions.text: A 55-year-old obese man (body mass index = 31.0) with type 2 diabetes mellitus and atrial fibrillation is found to have three-vessel coronary disease at angiography and is scheduled for coronary artery bypass graft surgery in 1 week. Which of the following conditions is associated with increased perioperative mortality in this specific patient?
questions.correct_answer: C. Atrial fibrillation

questions.text: A 38-year-old woman presents at the 37th week of pregnancy because of severe substernal chest pain over the past 30 minutes.Pain is radiating to left arm amd forearm.Pulse is 80/min,BP-110/70 mmHg.Chest is clear. An electrocardiogram demonstrates 4-mm ST segment elevations in leads V1 to V4. Which of the following statements is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: Coronary artery spasm is the most common cause of this finding during pregnancy

options.label: B
options.text: Coronary artery dissection is the most likely cause in the peripartum period

options.label: C
options.text: Pregnancy does not alter the risk of sustaining a myocardial infarction

options.label: D
options.text: Inferior wall myocardial infarction is more common than anterior wall myocardial infarction during pregnancy

questions.correct_answer: B. Coronary artery dissection is the most likely cause in the peripartum period

questions.text: An 83-year-old man with hypertension and diabetes underwent coronary artery bypass graft (CABG) surgery 14 hours ago on an emergency basis. Preoperative angiography revealed severe stenoses of the left main and right coronary arteries. During the operation, the left internal mammary artery was grafted to the native left anterior descending artery and saphenous vein grafts were anastomosed to the first obtuse marginal branch of the circumflex coronary artery and to the posterior descending artery. The surgeon consults you because he is concerned that the patient may have suffered a perioperative myocardial infarction (MI). Which of the following statements is NOT correct?

options.label: A
options.text: His age, the emergency nature of his procedure, and the presence of left main coronary artery disease put this patient at increased risk for perioperative MI

options.label: B
options.text: Chest pain is not a reliable sign of MI in the post-CABG patient

options.label: C
options.text: An elevation of cardiac-specific troponin T more than three times the 99% upper reference limit is diagnostic of MI in this setting

options.label: D
options.text: The finding of new Q waves on the electrocardiogram is a reliable sign of perioperative MI

questions.correct_answer: C. An elevation of cardiac-specific troponin T more than three times the 99% upper reference limit is diagnostic of MI in this setting

questions.text: A 78-year-old man presents with chest pain associated with palpitations, ghabharahat and dyspnea. On examination pulse is 100/min,BP-150/90 mmHg, chest reveals crepts at bases, CVS-normal. ECG done shows 2-mm ST-segment elevations in leads V1 to V3.Troponin is elevated. Which of the following statements is true regarding the management of acute myocardial infarction (MI) in elderly patients?

options.label: A
options.text: Elderly patients are less likely than younger patients to benefit from beta blockade for secondary prevention

options.label: B
options.text: Antiplatelet therapy with prasugrel leads to superior outcomes compared with clopidogrel in patients >75 years of age who undergo percutaneous intervention

options.label: C
options.text: Angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitors have been shown to reduce fatal and nonfatal events after MI in elderly patients

options.label: D
options.text: Fibrin-specific fibrinolytic agents are not associated with increased intracerebral bleeding rates in patients >75 years

questions.correct_answer: A. Elderly patients are less likely than younger patients to benefit from beta blockade for secondary prevention

questions.text: A 69-year-old woman presents for a routine office visit. She has a history of hypertension and her blood pressure today is 165/90 mm Hg. Left ventricular S4 is noted. There is no other abnormal heart sounds or murmur. Chest is clear on auscultation. The only medication is metoprolol succinate 25 mg daily. Which of the following statements regarding hypertension in the elderly is TRUE?

options.label: A
options.text: Therapy for isolated systolic hypertension in the elderly does not reduce the incidence of future cardiac events

options.label: B
options.text: Clinical trials have shown that beta blockers offer less cardiovascular protection than diuretic therapy

options.label: C
options.text: The presence of left ventricular hypertrophy in hypertensive patients >65 years is not an independent risk factor for adverse cardiovascular outcomes

options.label: D
options.text: Hypertensive hypertrophic cardiomyopathy of the elderly is more common in men

questions.correct_answer: B. Clinical trials have shown that beta blockers offer less cardiovascular protection than diuretic therapy

questions.text: A 60-year-old woman with a history of hypertension and diabetes mellitus is admitted to the hospital because of an acute severe headache, nausea, and vomiting. Physical examination demonstrates a blood pressure of 180/90 mm Hg, normal jugular venous pressure, bibasilar rales, no cardiac gallops or murmurs, and no focal neurologic signs. The troponin I is elevated at 0.62 ng/dL (normal: Computed tomography of the brain demonstrates an acute subarachnoid hemorrhage. The patient’s electrocardiogram is shown .Which of the following statements is TRUE?

options.label: A
options.text: A ruptured coronary plaque with partially occlusive thrombus is likely present

options.label: B
options.text: QT interval prolongation is uncommon in this setting

options.label: C
options.text: All of the cardiac abnormalities can be attributed to autonomic dysfunction in the setting of acute brain injury

options.label: D
options.text: Beta blockers are not effective at controlling ventricular tachycardia and fibrillation in this situation

questions.correct_answer: C. All of the cardiac abnormalities can be attributed to autonomic dysfunction in the setting of acute brain injury

questions.text: A 27-year-old woman undergoes right-sided heart catheterization for the assessment of suspected pulmonary arterial hypertension. The mean pulmonary artery pressure (PAP) is 44 mm Hg, and the pulmonary capillary wedge pressure (PCWP) is 11 mm Hg. Infusion of epoprostenol reduces the mean PAP to 31 mm Hg with no significant change in systemic blood pressure or PCWP. Which of the following statements is NOT correct?

options.label: A
options.text: Both intravenous adenosine and inhaled nitric oxide are alternative useful agents to assess vasoreactivity

options.label: B
options.text: The observed drop in mean PAP is predictive of a favorable response to oral calcium channel blockers

options.label: C
options.text: The failure of the systemic blood pressure to decline suggests that the vasodilator challenge was ineffective

options.label: D
options.text: Very high doses of chronic calcium channel blocker therapy would likely be necessary to realize full clinical benefit

questions.correct_answer: C. The failure of the systemic blood pressure to decline suggests that the vasodilator challenge was ineffective

questions.text: A 42-year-old woman presents to her primary care physician with recent fatigue and weight gain. She also complaint of menorrhagia. On examination facial puffiness is noted with dry skin. Non tender thyromegaly is noted. Laboratory evaluation reveals a low free T3 and T4 with markedly elevated thyroid-stimulating hormone level. Which of the following is NOT a common cardiac finding in patients with hypothyroidism?
questions.correct_answer: A. Hypotension

questions.text: A 28-year-old woman with Marfan syndrome presents for an office visit. On examination mid systolic click present at apex with early diastolic murmur at right sternal margin. Her echocardiogram shows mitral valve prolapse, an aortic root diameter of 4.5 cm, and mild aortic regurgitation. Which of the following statements regarding cardiovascular disease in patients with Marfan syndrome is NOT correct?

options.label: A
options.text: 60-80% of patients with Marfan syndrome have mitral valve prolapse on echocardiography

options.label: B
options.text: The development of aortic regurgitation correlates with the aortic root diameter

options.label: C
options.text: Patients with Marfan syndrome should be considered for elective aortic root replacement once the aortic root diameter exceeds 5.5 cm

options.label: D
options.text: Beta blockers should be administered to all patients with Marfan syndrome unless a contraindication exists

questions.correct_answer: C. Patients with Marfan syndrome should be considered for elective aortic root replacement once the aortic root diameter exceeds 5.5 cm

questions.text: A 54-year-old man was admitted to the hospital because of acute pulmonary embolism. Intravenous administration of heparin was begun. On admission, the platelet count was 223,000/µL. Four days later it fell to 16,000/µL, although the patient remained asymptomatic, without overt bleeding. Which of the following statements regarding this patient’s condition is TRUE?

options.label: A
options.text: Low-molecular-weight heparin can be safely substituted for intravenous unfractionated heparin

options.label: B
options.text: A direct thrombin inhibitor, such as Lepirudin, should be substituted for heparin

options.label: C
options.text: Intravenous heparin should be continued, because the low platelet count represents a laboratory artifact without clinical significance

options.label: D
options.text: Antibodies directed against the platelet glycoprotein IIb/ IIIa receptor participate in this disorder

questions.correct_answer: B. A direct thrombin inhibitor, such as Lepirudin, should be substituted for heparin

questions.text: A 51-year-old woman presents to discuss anticoagulation options for atrial fibrillation. Her history is notable for rheumatic mitral stenosis, which led to mitral valve replacement with a St. Jude mechanical prosthesis 6 years ago. She had atrial fibrillation prior to cardiac surgery and it has persisted thereafter. She has been maintained successfully on warfarin anticoagulation, but she wishes to free herself of the required frequent testing of the prothrombin time and dose adjustments. She asks if one of the newer anticoagulants would be an option for her. She has normal renal function. Which of the agents below would be appropriate for this patient?
questions.correct_answer: D. None of the above

questions.text: While volunteering at a medical clinic in rural India, you are asked to examine a 12-year-old girl who presents with fever, migratory polyarthritis, and an erythematous rash on her trunk that forms a snakelike ring with central clearing. Her cardiac examination is notable for a soft, high-pitched pansystolic murmur at the apex. She recalls a prolonged painful pharyngitis a few weeks ago. Two older family members are known to have mitral stenosis. In addition to the “major criteria” used for diagnosing this patient’s likely condition, each of the following would offer supporting evidence EXCEPT
questions.correct_answer: A. Prolonged QT interval

questions.text: A 42-year-old woman with rheumatoid arthritis presents with exertional dyspnea. There is no cough, fever or chest pain. On examination BP-110/80 mmHg, CVS is normal, Lungs- clear. Echocardiography demonstrates a small circumferential pericardial effusion without hemodynamic compromise. Which of the following statements regarding cardiovascular involvement in rheumatoid arthritis is TRUE?

options.label: A
options.text: Acute pericarditis related to RA occurs in 10% to 15% of patients

options.label: B
options.text: Patients with RA have a reduced incidence of clinical CAD compared to the general population

options.label: C
options.text: Conduction system disease in RA is most commonly due to inflammation of the conduction system

options.label: D
options.text: Women with RA are twice as likely as age-matched controls to suffer myocardial infarction

questions.correct_answer: D. Women with RA are twice as likely as age-matched controls to suffer myocardial infarction

questions.text: A 76-year-old man with hypertension and diabetes is found to have atrial fibrillation for the first time at a routine office visit. He has no history of cardiac symptoms, and an echocardiogram shows normal left ventricular contractile function and no valvular disease or pericardial effusion. His physician initiates dabigatran for long-term anticoagulation. Which of the following statements is TRUE?

options.label: A
options.text: Anticoagulation for this patient is not warranted because his risk of thromboembolism is low

options.label: B
options.text: Dabigatran is an oral factor Xa inhibitor

options.label: C
options.text: The risk of stroke or systemic embolism with dabigatran is lower than that with warfarin anticoagulation and a target international normalized ratio of 2.0 to 3.0

options.label: D
options.text: Dabigatran is associated with a higher rate of hemorrhagic stroke than warfarin anticoagulation

questions.correct_answer: C. The risk of stroke or systemic embolism with dabigatran is lower than that with warfarin anticoagulation and a target international normalized ratio of 2.0 to 3.0

questions.text: A 66-year-old man with a history of atrial fibrillation successfully suppressed by amiodarone presents with tremors and recent weight loss. On examination tremors of outstretched hands present. Pulse is 120/min,BP160/60 mmHg, CVS-tachycardia, lungs-clear. His physician suspects amiodarone induced thyroid dysfunction. Which of the following statements about amiodarone and thyroid function is NOT correct?

options.label: A
options.text: Amiodarone inhibits the peripheral conversion of thyroxine (T4) to triiodothyronine (T3)

options.label: B
options.text: During initial therapy, amiodarone decreases thyroid stimulating hormone levels

options.label: C
options.text: Glucocorticoid therapy is beneficial for patients with amiodarone-induced hyperthyroidism who have elevated circulating levels of interleukin-6

options.label: D
options.text: Amiodarone’s iodine content inhibits synthesis and release of T4 from the thyroid gland

questions.correct_answer: B. During initial therapy, amiodarone decreases thyroid stimulating hormone levels

questions.text: A 54-year-old man presents for evaluation of excessive daytime sleepiness. His wife has observed his prominent snoring and gasping at night. On examination pulse is 100/min,BP-150/90 mmHg, chest is clear on auscultation.CVS-normal.BMI-35. Which of the following statements regarding sleep-related breathing disorders and cardiovascular disease is NOT correct?

options.label: A
options.text: Individuals with obstructive sleep apnea exhibit persistently increased sympathetic activity, even during daytime wakefulness

options.label: B
options.text: Obstructive sleep apnea is associated with drug-resistant hypertension and tachycardia.

options.label: C
options.text: Positive airway pressure therapy in obstructive sleep apnea is associated with improved health-related quality-of-life and blood pressure

options.label: D
options.text: Unlike obstructive sleep apnea, central sleep apnea is not associated with cardiovascular disease

questions.correct_answer: D. Unlike obstructive sleep apnea, central sleep apnea is not associated with cardiovascular disease

questions.text: A previously healthy 36-year-old woman presents to her primary care physician 3 weeks after the delivery of her second child because of new dyspnea, orthopnea, and peripheral edema. On examination, she appears fatigued. The blood pressure is 100/70 mm Hg and the heart rate is 120 beats/min. The jugular venous pressure is 12 cm H2O. There are basilar rales, a prominent apical S3 gallop, hepatomegaly, and bilateral lower extremity edema. An echocardiogram shows four-chamber cardiac enlargement and severe, global reduction of biventricular systolic function, compared with a normal study before pregnancy. Which of the following statements regarding this patient’s condition is NOT correct?

options.label: A
options.text: The incidence of this disorder is greater with twin pregnancies

options.label: B
options.text: Approximately half of the patients with this disorder will completely recover normal cardiac function

options.label: C
options.text: Subsequent pregnancies are usually well tolerated

options.label: D
options.text: This condition becomes symptomatic in most patients during the last trimester of gestation or in the early postpartum period

questions.correct_answer: C. Subsequent pregnancies are usually well tolerated

questions.text: A 67-year-old man with coronary artery disease (CAD) presents with presyncope. The symptoms are not related to physical activity. On examination pulse is 54/min, irregular, BP-130/80 mmHg, chest-clear on auscultation, CVS-S1 has variable intensity, no murmurs. The electrocardiogram (ECG) shows Wenckebach’s type atrioventricular (AV) block. Which of the following are you most likely to see on the ECG?

options.label: B
options.text: Progressive lengthening of the PR interval

questions.correct_answer: B. Progressive lengthening of the PR interval

questions.text: A 72-year-old woman had a pacemaker inserted 4 years ago for symptomatic bradycardia because of AV nodal disease. She is clinically feeling well and her ECG shows normal sinus rhythm at a rate of 68/min but no pacemaker spikes. Her pacemaker only functions when the ventricular rate falls below a preset interval. Which of the following best describes her pacemaker function?
questions.correct_answer: D. Ventricular inhibited

questions.text: A 42-year-old man develops shortness of breath and chest pain 7 days after an open cholecystectomy. He was non-ambulatory during this period. His blood pressure is 145/86 mm Hg, pulse is 120/min, respirations 24/min, and oxygen saturation of 97%. Pulmonary embolism is clinically suspected. Which of the following is the most common ECG finding of pulmonary embolism?

options.label: C
options.text: Prominent Q wave in lead III

options.label: D
options.text: Deep S wave in Lead I

questions.correct_answer: A. Sinus tachycardia

questions.text: A 70-year-old woman develops exertional angina and has had two episodes of syncope. She also started developing dyspnea on physical activity. There is no significant past medical history. She is not taking any medications. On examination pulse is 60/min, regular, BP-110/80 mmHg, chest is clear on auscultation, CVS-soft S2 sound and systolic ejection murmur at right second parasternal area with radiation to the carotids. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.correct_answer: C. Aortic stenosis

questions.text: A 42-year-old man with known rheumatic heart disease develops fever for 1 week. He c/o palpitations and dyspnea. On examination he appears unwell; CVS findings include a pansystolic murmur at the apex that radiates to the axilla and a soft S1 sound. He has petechiae on his conjunctiva, linear hemorrhages under a few fingernails, and non tender, erythematous macular lesions on palms. Which of the following is the most responsible mechanism for these physical findings?
questions.correct_answer: C. Vascular phenomena

questions.text: A 67-year-old man presents with an anterior myocardial infarction (MI) and receives thrombolytic therapy. Three days later, he develops chest pain that is exacerbated by lying down, and his physical findings are normal except for a friction rub. His ECG shows evolving changes from the anterior infarction but new PR-segment depression and 1-mm ST-segment elevation in all the limb leads. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.correct_answer: D. Post-MI pericarditis

questions.text: A 22-year-old prima gravida woman develops hypertension at 28 weeks. She is asymptomatic and the examination is normal except for 1+ pedal edema. Her complete blood count, liver enzymes, and electrolytes are normal. The urinalysis is positive for proteinuria. Which of the following is true for this type of hypertension?
questions.correct_answer: C. Should be controlled with medications

questions.text: A 61-year-old man has a non-ST-elevation MI and is admitted to the coronary care unit. The following day, he develops bradycardia but no symptoms. His blood pressure is 126/84 mm Hg, pulse 50/min, and on examination, the heart sounds are normal, with no extra sounds or rubs. His ECG has changed. Which of the following ECG findings is the best indication for this patient to receive a pacemaker?

options.label: A
options.text: Left bundle branch block (LBBB) and second-degree AV block Mobitz type II

options.label: B
options.text: Second-degree AV block Mobitz type I

questions.correct_answer: A. Left bundle branch block (LBBB) and second-degree AV block Mobitz type II

questions.text: A 17 year old boy presented with dyspnea on exertion for last 2 months. There is no fever, cough, sputum, wheezing or chest pain. On examination pulse is 100/min,BP-110/70 mmHg, chest-clear, CVS- there is increased intensity of the pulmonary component of the second heart sound. No cardiac murmur noted.Chest x ray is done as shown in the figure. Which of the following explanations is the most likely cause of his dyspnea?
questions.correct_answer: D. Pulmonary hypertension

questions.text: A 22-year-old woman complains of palpitations which is sudden onset. There is no significant past medical history. On examination pulse is 150/min and regular. JVP showed cannon a waves. Blood pressure is 110/70 mm Hg. The rate abruptly changes to 75/min after applying carotid sinus pressure. Now she c/o of increased urine output. ECG is shown in the figure. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.correct_answer: B. Paroxysmal supraventricular tachycardia (PSVT)

questions.text: A 73-year-old man c/o chest pain on exertion. He also has intermittent episodes of syncope on exercise. On examination pulse is 70/min,regular,BP-130/74 mmHg, CVS-systolic murmur at aortic area which is best heard on leaning forward and expiration. ECG revealed LVH voltage criteria. Coronary angiography done reveals noncritical stenosis of the coronary arteries. This occurs most frequently with which of the following valvular heart diseases?
questions.correct_answer: D. Aortic stenosis

questions.text: A 80 year old male patient presented with new-onset syncope, chest pain and dyspnea on exertion. On examination blood pressure is 110/95 mm Hg. Auscultation of heart revealed a systolic ejection murmur at right second intercostal space, radiating to carotids. Auscultation of the second heart sound at the base might reveal which of the following findings?
questions.correct_answer: B. Diminished

questions.text: A 69-year-old woman complains of easy fatigue and one episode of presyncope. There is no past history of valvular heart disease or hypertension. She is not taking any medicines. On examination pulse is 50/min and regular, BP-140/60 mmHg. In jugular venous pressure (JVP), there are irregular cannon a waves. ECG is shown in figure and reveals fixed PP and RR intervals but varying PR intervals. Which of the following conditions is this most likely caused by?

options.label: B
options.text: Independent beating of atria and ventricles

questions.correct_answer: B. Independent beating of atria and ventricles

questions.text: A 57-year-old man presented with chest pain and dyspnea of acute onset. ECG showed ST elevation in inferior wall leads (II,III and aVF).Troponin done is elevated. Chest has crepts. You made a clinical diagnosis of ST elevation MI complicated by heart failure. You started oxygen, aspirin and planning for PCI. Nitroglycerin would be a useful first medication under which circumstances?

options.label: A
options.text: Pulmonary congestion, blood pressure 80 mm Hg systolic

options.label: B
options.text: RVMI involvement and blood pressure 120 mm Hg systolic

options.label: C
options.text: Pulmonary congestion, blood pressure 130 mm Hg systolic

options.label: D
options.text: Pulmonary congestion blood pressure 94 mm Hg systolic

questions.correct_answer: C. Pulmonary congestion, blood pressure 130 mm Hg systolic

questions.text: A 28-year-old man c/o fever for 3 weeks. He also developed palpitations and dyspnea. On examination temperature is 38.5 C, pulse is 120/min,BP-110/80 mmHg, oslers nodes, Janeway lesion and splinter haemorrhage seen. Abdomen examination revealed splenomegaly. Urine examination showed hematuria. You are suspecting a case of infective endocarditis. Which of the following cardiac lesions will be most likely present?
questions.correct_answer: A. Ventricular septal defect

questions.text: A 47-year-old woman has new-onset transient right arm weakness and word finding difficulty symptoms lasting 3 hours. She is also experiencing exertional dyspnea, and had a syncopal event 1 month ago. On examination temperature is 38 C, clubbing is present and spleen is palpable. Her echocardiogram reveals a cardiac tumor in the left atrium, it is pedunculated and attached to the endocardium. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this lesion?
questions.correct_answer: A. Myxoma

questions.text: A 72-year-old woman presented with palpitations and dyspnea. There is no past history of heart disease. On examination pulse is 150/min and is regular. BP-150/90 mmHg, lungs are clear on auscultation, CVS-tachycardia, no murmurs. ECG showed saw tooth P wave appearance with atrial rate of 300/min and 2:1 conduction ratio from atria to ventricles. Which of the following drugs is the best intravenous choice for controlling the heart rate?
questions.correct_answer: A. Diltiazem

questions.text: A 58-year-old man is a known case of type 2 diabetes. He c/o chest pain exertion. Resting ECG is normal and he cannot undergo TMT due to knee joint pain. You advice for cardiac catheterization for evaluation of chest pain symptoms. He is worried about the risks, and as part of obtaining informed consent, you advise him about the risks and benefits of the procedure. Which of the following aspects of angiography is true?

options.label: C
options.text: It is generally performed with cardiopulmonary bypass

questions.correct_answer: D. It may cause renal failure

questions.text: A 23-year-old man develops sharp left-sided chest pain, fever, and a friction rub heard at the lower left sternal border, unaffected by respiration. The pain is also aggevated by lying down and relieved by sitting up. He is otherwise well with no other symptoms and the remaining physical examination is normal. Which of the following is the most likely cause for his symptoms?
questions.correct_answer: B. Coxsackievirus
